intro: Ericoides chamissonis, commonly known as the coastal beardtongue, is a flowering plant native to the western coast of North America. It is a member of the Plantaginaceae family and typically grows in rocky, coastal environments. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, adapted to withstand salty sea air and strong winds. Ericoides chamissonis plays an important role in stabilizing coastal dunes and providing nectar for pollinators.
